dt: {bc}to make (someone or something) numb: such as
{bc}to cause (a part of the body) to lose sensation

dt.t: The injection will {wi}numb{/wi} the area to be operated on.

dt: {bc}to make (someone) unable to think, feel, or react normally

dt.t: But there is no humor in {it}Natural Born Killers{/it}. It is a relentlessly bloody story designed to shock us and to {wi}numb{/wi} us further to the senselessness of reckless murder.
In her last book, {it}Regarding the Pain of Others{/it}, Susan Sontag disputes the notion that viewers are {wi}numbed{/wi} by an onslaught of photographed calamities.
But Madame Melmotte was neither crushed by grief nor did she affect to be so crushed. She had been {wi}numbed{/wi} by the suddenness and by the awe of the catastrophe.

shortdef: to make (someone or something) numb: such as
to cause (a part of the body) to lose sensation
to impair in force or sensation : deaden
